intro: Andriapetalum multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid environments. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
